summary: Internal email chain among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff discussing logistics for a press conference to announce charges against Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails cover COVID-19 safety protocols, venue selection (lobby vs. other options), and timing of the arrest/announcement.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: She is the Acting U.S. Attorney who will be speaking at the press conference announcing charges against Ghislaine Maxwell. Staff discuss arranging a walk-through of the venue for her.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the press conference; she is to be charged for her role in the sexual exploitation and abuse of multiple minor girls by Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the primary perpetrator whose sexual exploitation and abuse of minor girls Ghislaine Maxwell allegedly facilitated.

connections.description: Maxwell is charged for her role in facilitating the sexual exploitation and abuse of multiple minor girls by Epstein.
Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is the lead prosecutor announcing criminal charges against Maxwell.

events.title: Press Conference Announcing Ghislaine Maxwell Charges
events.description: Press conference to be held by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to announce criminal charges against Ghislaine Maxwell for her role in Jeffrey Epstein's sexual exploitation and abuse of minor girls.

events.title: Potential Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Internal email indicates the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell was possible on July 1 but might be pushed to July 2, 2020.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York
Duane Street (side of a building, likely referencing the SDNY or FBI office location)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was planning a press conference for July 1, 2020, to announce charges against Ghislaine Maxwell related to Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minors.
The arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell was imminent, with timing possibly on June 30, July 1, or July 2, 2020.
Logistical planning for the press conference was complicated by COVID-19, requiring safety protocols like masks and social distancing.
Venue options for the press conference included the SDNY lobby and an 'IM' option, with concerns about acoustics and equipment.
The document reveals internal government coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and the FBI press office on event logistics.
